episodeTitle: Moving into the Final Phase! Whitebeard's Trump Card for Recovery!
description: Whitebeard unveils his hidden coated paddle ship as his trump card, allowing his pirates to breach Marineford's plaza through Oars Jr.'s assistance. Crocodile surprisingly intervenes to save Ace from execution, while Luffy continues his desperate push toward the execution platform despite being repeatedly knocked back by admirals Kizaru and Aokiji. As the Whitebeard Pirates reach the plaza, both Sengoku and Garp prepare for the final confrontation.

events.title: Luffy Attempts to Break Through Admirals
events.description: Luffy in Gear Second attempts to slip past the three admirals to reach Ace on the execution platform, but Kizaru effortlessly catches up to him and knocks him to the ground with a devastating attack.
events.significance: Demonstrates the overwhelming power gap between Luffy and the admirals at this point in the story, showing how unprepared Luffy is to face top-tier Marine forces.

events.title: Marco Protects Luffy from Aokiji
events.description: After Luffy is knocked down by Kizaru, Aokiji moves in to finish him off with an ice attack. However, Marco the Phoenix intervenes at the last moment, kicking Aokiji away and saving Luffy's life.
events.significance: Shows the Whitebeard Pirates' commitment to helping Luffy reach Ace, recognizing their shared goal of rescuing Ace from execution.

events.title: Sengoku Orders Ace's Immediate Execution
events.description: Fleet Admiral Sengoku, recognizing the deteriorating situation as Whitebeard's forces advance, orders the executioners to carry out Ace's execution immediately rather than waiting for the scheduled time.
events.significance: Escalates the urgency of the battle dramatically, forcing everyone to race against time to either save or ensure Ace's execution.

events.title: Crocodile Saves Ace from Execution
events.description: Just as the executioners prepare to kill Ace, Crocodile unexpectedly intervenes, using his sand powers to strike down the executioners. He declares that he doesn't want the Marines to taste victory, shocking both allies and enemies present at Marineford.
events.significance: This surprising intervention marks a pivotal character moment for Crocodile, showing his complex motivations and his deep hatred for the World Government. It temporarily saves Ace's life and changes the dynamic of the battle.

quotes.text: I can kill Whitebeard later. I don't want them to taste victory.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Explaining why he saved Ace from execution despite being Whitebeard's enemy

events.title: Doflamingo Attacks Crocodile
events.description: Donquixote Doflamingo, claiming to be jealous that Crocodile appeared to team up with Whitebeard, slices Crocodile's head with his string powers. Crocodile quickly recovers using his Logia abilities and the two Warlords begin fighting, with Crocodile insisting he teams up with nobody.
events.significance: Introduces conflict among the Warlords themselves, showing the chaotic nature of the Marineford War where allegiances are complex and shifting.

quotes.text: I will team up with nobody.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Rejecting Doflamingo's insinuation that he allied with Whitebeard

events.title: Mr. 3 Infiltrates Marineford's Underground
events.description: Galdino (Mr. 3), having escaped from Aokiji's ice earlier, successfully infiltrates deep into Marineford's underground passages. He panics when an alert is announced, believing he is being chased by Marines.
events.significance: Sets up Mr. 3's positioning for a crucial role later in the arc, though his importance is not yet clear in this episode.

events.title: Whitebeard's Coated Ship Strategy Revealed
events.description: Whitebeard reveals his trump card: a hidden coated paddle ship that remained submerged in the bay. As the Whitebeard Pirates rush toward an opening in the wall, Whitebeard commands the paddle ship to surface, catching the Marines completely by surprise.
events.significance: Demonstrates Whitebeard's tactical genius and the advanced coating technology in the One Piece world. This strategy allows the pirates to bypass the Marines' defensive positions.

quotes.text: I never said all of my ships had surfaced.
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Revealing his hidden coated paddle ship as a trump card

events.title: Oars Jr. Propels Ship into Plaza
events.description: Despite being severely wounded and falling unconscious, Little Oars Jr. uses his last ounce of strength to pull the coated paddle ship out of the water and propel it into Marineford's plaza, creating a safe passage for the Whitebeard Pirates. Before losing consciousness, he tells Whitebeard to save Ace.
events.significance: Oars Jr.'s sacrifice enables the Whitebeard Pirates to successfully reach the plaza, turning the tide of the battle and bringing them within striking distance of the execution platform.

quotes.speaker: Little Oars Jr.
quotes.context: His last words before falling unconscious after helping the crew

events.title: Whitebeard Pirates Reach the Plaza
events.description: Thanks to Oars Jr.'s sacrifice and the coated ship strategy, the Whitebeard Pirates successfully breach Marineford's defenses and pour into the plaza, bringing them face-to-face with the Marine elite forces and within range of rescuing Ace.
events.significance: This marks the transition into the final phase of the Marineford War, with both sides now engaged in direct, close-quarters combat in the plaza.

events.title: Whitebeard Unleashes Massive Shockwave
events.description: Upon entering the plaza, Whitebeard unleashes a devastating shockwave attack with his Gura Gura no Mi powers, demonstrating the terrifying might of the world's strongest man and clearing a path for his forces.
events.significance: Showcases Whitebeard's overwhelming power even in his weakened state, reminding everyone present why he is considered the strongest man in the world.

events.title: Sengoku and Garp Prepare to Fight
events.description: Recognizing that Whitebeard is about to attack with his full force and that the battle has reached its climax, both Fleet Admiral Sengoku and Vice Admiral Garp decide they must enter the battle directly to stop the Whitebeard Pirates.
events.significance: Marks the point where the Marine's two strongest fighters, who have been observing until now, prepare to engage directly. This escalation shows how desperate the situation has become.

events.title: Kibin's Debut
events.description: Commodore Kibin, a Marine officer with a jutte weapon, makes his first appearance during the Marineford battle. He is shown attempting to stop Luffy's advance using Rokushiki techniques but is ultimately defeated.
events.significance: Introduces a minor Marine character who demonstrates the mid-tier strength of Marine officers at Marineford.

quotes.text: I can kill Whitebeard later. I don't want them to taste victory.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Explaining his decision to save Ace from execution

quotes.text: I will team up with nobody.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Responding to Doflamingo's attack and insinuation

quotes.text: I never said all of my ships had surfaced.
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Revealing his hidden coated paddle ship

themes.description: The episode showcases Whitebeard's tactical brilliance with his coated ship strategy, demonstrating that even in direct combat, intelligence and planning are crucial.
themes.symbolism: The hidden coated ship represents Whitebeard's ability to think several steps ahead, holding back a trump card for the crucial moment.

themes.description: Crocodile's intervention to save Ace demonstrates the complex web of motivations and allegiances at Marineford, where traditional enemies may temporarily work toward similar goals.
themes.symbolism: Crocodile saving Ace symbolizes how shared hatred of a common enemy (the World Government) can transcend personal rivalries.

themes.description: Oars Jr.'s sacrifice to help the Whitebeard Pirates reach the plaza exemplifies the deep bonds of loyalty within Whitebeard's crew.
themes.symbolism: Oars Jr. using his last strength to create a path represents the selfless devotion Whitebeard inspires in his crew members.

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile reveals his complex motivations by saving Ace from execution, showing his deep hatred for the World Government supersedes his rivalry with Whitebeard.
keyActions: Saves Ace from execution by striking down the executioners
Declares he doesn't want the Marines to win
Insists he teams up with nobody
quotes: I can kill Whitebeard later. I don't want them to taste victory.
I will team up with nobody.

characterSpotlights.development: Whitebeard demonstrates his tactical genius by revealing a hidden coated ship, showing he planned several contingencies for rescuing Ace.
keyActions: Commands hidden paddle ship to surface
Coordinates with Oars Jr. to breach the plaza
Unleashes massive shockwave attack upon entering plaza
Leads his forces in the final push to rescue Ace
quotes: I never said all of my ships had surfaced.

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being mortally wounded, Oars Jr. uses his last strength to help his crew, demonstrating the loyalty Whitebeard inspires.
keyActions: Pulls the coated paddle ship from the water despite severe wounds
Propels the ship into the plaza
Creates safe passage for the Whitebeard Pirates
Falls unconscious after asking Whitebeard to save Ace

characterSpotlights.development: Marco continues to demonstrate his role as Whitebeard's right hand, protecting Luffy and facilitating the rescue mission.
keyActions: Supports the advance into the plaza

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, additional scenes show how Mr. 3 escaped Aokiji's attack and infiltrated the underground base at Marineford, which were not detailed in the manga.
After the Whitebeard Commanders reached the plaza, the anime shows Pandaman jumping from the ship whereas the manga shows Palms.

trivia.fact: Episode 475 achieved an 11.9% TV rating in Japan, ranking 3rd in viewership for its timeslot, demonstrating the high viewer engagement during the Marineford Arc.

The opening song 'One day' by The ROOTLESS is notably more somber than previous One Piece openings, reflecting the dark tone of the Marineford Arc. The opening was later updated in Episode 485 to show four new members of the Blackbeard Pirates.
Commodore Kibin, who debuts in this episode, was given his name and rank only in the anime. In the manga, he appears but is unnamed.
This episode covers only pages 3-19 of Chapter 566, showing the slower pacing typical of the Marineford Arc episodes to maintain quality animation during intense battle scenes.

The voice actor for Whitebeard in this episode, Kinryū Arimoto, would later be succeeded by Ryūzaburō Ōtomo (who also voices Crocodile) after Arimoto's passing. This creates an interesting situation where both characters in their confrontation would later share the same voice actor.
